itemDescription: English and Welsh rugby league footballer (b. 1995)

wikipedia_page.main: Matthew Ian Fozard (born 3 March 1995) is a Wales international rugby league footballer who plays as a hooker for the Widnes Vikings in the RFL Championship.He previously played for St Helens in the Super League, and on loan from Saints at the Batley Bulldogs in the Championship and the Rochdale Hornets in Championship 1. Fozard also played for the Sheffield Eagles in the Championship and previously played for the Broncos in the Betfred Super League and the Championship.

response: In 2019, however, things were looking up for the side as they brought in 14 new signings, including ex-Eagles Jason Crookes, James Davey and Pat Walker, but lost key players in Joshua Toole (Forbes), Matty Fozard (London). They got off to a flying start as they overcame the challenges of Swinton, Barrow and Bradford in the first month of the new season. That year saw the Eagles return to Wembley for the first time in more than 2 decades to claim the inaugural 1895 Cup by defeating Widnes 38–16. However, their League season was less of a success as they finished in 7th place.
* Matty Fozard won caps for Wales at 2017 World Cup Papua New Guinea (sub), Fiji (sub) and Ireland
* Matty Fozard (born 1995), English rugby league player

response: *On 2 October, Matty Fozard pulled out of the squad due to a broken jaw. He was replaced by Connor Farrer.
